title: 加拿大移民落腳嚟講，多倫多定溫哥華?

replies.msg:
小弟係香港做開Code狗
計劃下一年申請移民去加拿大
呢家掙扎緊落腳去多倫多定溫哥華

上網做過下少少Research
物價嚟講其實多倫多同溫哥華差唔多
溫哥華嘅租可能會比多倫多再貴多少少, 但多倫多車保又貴過溫哥華

工作方面, 由於Ontario 比較大, 多倫多IT工作機會可能比較多,

呢兩年溫哥華都多咗好多BigTech 進註, IT 人才市場都expand緊


人工方面, 溫哥華應該會高過多倫多少少



其實綜合以上, 如果為咗要達到拎PR 為目的 (3年working visa 內, 有1年當地工作經驗), 多倫多可能比較適合

但天氣嚟講, 多倫多成半年都喺度落緊雪, 另一方面溫哥華四季氣候宜人, 唔會話好凍, 呢點令到我好掙扎。

想請教下, 有冇住喺加拿大嘅巴絲可以再分享一下當地嘅情況, 感激不盡。
你個表係邊度搵㗎

quote.msg: 你個表係邊度搵㗎

replies.msg: CBRE Research 同 Statistic Canada
Amazon warehouse 捱一年先

簡單啲講: 多倫多
除非溫哥華有學校收你, 有公司請你, 有親友接濟你, 否則都係去多倫多
利申: 住美國

quote.msg: Amazon warehouse 捱一年先

replies.msg:
美國啲 fulfillment center (warehouse) 比較遠
要揸車返工
加拿大有冇啲 warehouse 可以搭巴士返工?

留明 同幾個朋友成日傾呢個話顯
溫哥華天氣 多倫多機會

quote.msg:
留明 同幾個朋友成日傾呢個話顯
溫哥華天氣 多倫多機會

replies.msg:
其實溫哥華既冬天, 人地叫「濕凍」, 有啲似英國嗰種
冬天日日落雨, 好少出太陽
當然夏天就一流啦, 尤其是你鍾意 nature, hiking trail

樓主本身做開大公司？
我都係it 狗寫開code咁岩讀完master想走
但我做開in house development
去到唔知搵到咩野工

邊個同你講ontario車保平過BC
BC認第二冇人敢認第一

利申：俾緊5000cad一年，普通車
BC 養車貴過閪 人工全加拿大最低⋯

toronto>Vancouver
多倫多就業機會多啲 vancouver車insurance其實都貴 van物價同地價都貴過toronto
多倫多雖然凍過溫哥華但係每間屋都有暖氣就唔係好覺 同埋預左出去都係要有車所以分別不大 同埋西岸落大雪係會成個城市癱左咁 佢地處理雪嗰啲唔夠東岸快 但係東岸因為啲人習慣左佢地政府有多啲措施去應對
利申幾年前係seattle讀書 而家係toronto

但我做開in house development
去到唔知搵到咩野工

replies.msg:
住加拿大唔揸車邊到去唔到，連買餸食野都有排煩
大部分warehouse 都遠離city近highway口，所以一定要揸車
其實點解canada 咁撚貴車保

Toronto.
Vancouver住咗五年、除咗天氣好，無野好。
諗住番Toronto. 利申on 出世

二線 Calgary Edmonton 點睇

收入好似全加頭幾名 但生活條件又唔算太高

雖然輸油管計劃好似衰左

replies.msg:
Thanks 巴打
我都諗緊可能今年去加拿大,做左幾年野又儲左d錢,上年讀完個master睇下有冇機會過去順便拎pr
後生仔一定多倫多

多倫多唔駛唸
利申，身處多倫多兩小時車程的城市

話多倫多半年落雪既人一定未係多倫多生活過
冬天由十一月開始到三月，但真正落大雪出唔到街既日子加埋唔過十一
一落完第二日/即日都剷好哂
所以半年落雪係都市傳說

利申：住左差唔多十年

一律建議Toronto，機會多 d。
同埋Vancouver天氣其實一啖砂糖一啖屎，夏天係無得頂但十月落雨落到三四月，仲要無誇張係差唔多日日落嗰隻，唔落雨嘅時候就九成陰天，個人都灰d好易有depression。

溫哥華+1

利申住咗廿幾年

quote.msg:
小弟係香港做開Code狗
計劃下一年申請移民去加拿大
呢家掙扎緊落腳去多倫多定溫哥華

上網做過下少少Research
物價嚟講其實多倫多同溫哥華差唔多
溫哥華嘅租可能會比多倫多再貴多少少, 但多倫多車保又貴過溫哥華

工作方面, 由於Ontario 比較大, 多倫多IT工作機會可能比較多,

呢兩年溫哥華都多咗好多BigTech 進註, IT 人才市場都expand緊


人工方面, 溫哥華應該會高過多倫多少少



其實綜合以上, 如果為咗要達到拎PR 為目的 (3年working visa 內, 有1年當地工作經驗), 多倫多可能比較適合

但天氣嚟講, 多倫多成半年都喺度落緊雪, 另一方面溫哥華四季氣候宜人, 唔會話好凍, 呢點令到我好掙扎。

想請教下, 有冇住喺加拿大嘅巴絲可以再分享一下當地嘅情況, 感激不盡。

replies.msg:
你當多倫多冬天平均低溫哥華10度咁喇，溫哥華一年冇幾多日會零下，但多倫多就平均都零度上下五度之間上落，零下1X度也會有，但唔多。

溫哥華夏天夠涼爽，但多倫多近年越來越熱，七八月有起熱浪可以接近40度，日頭多數廿幾三十度， 但乾熱， 唔多會流汗。

https://www.holiday-weather.com/vancouver/averages
多倫多太凍！溫哥華會比較適合香港人。

replies.msg:
https://www.settler.ca/english/can-us-citizens-work-in-canada/
A work permit is a must for US workers in Canada.
Unless your job is exempt from a work permit, you must receive a permit to work in Canada. Unfortunately, this rule applies to US citizens just like other applicants. However, you may apply for a work permit at a port of entry. There are some exceptional cases that you are better off if you apply before entering Canada. Consequently, consult with a professional before travelling to Canada.

CUSMA an opportunity for US citizens to work in Canada
CUSMA, aka USMCA or NAFTA 2.0, is an economic treaty between Canada, the United States and Mexico. The main focus of CUSMA is the trade of goods and services between these countries. However, it also considers labour movements. As a result, you may work as a US citizen in Canada if one of the following CUSMA provisions apply to you.

Traders
Investors
Professionals
Intra-company transferees
Of course, the main benefit of CUSMA work permits is LMIA exemption.

Working as an American trader in Canada
CUSMA defines an American Trader as a US citizen who intends to get a work permit under the following circumstances:

They work for an American enterprise
Trade is mainly between the US, Canada and Mexico
Their activities focus on trade in services or goods
The position is executive, supervisory or needs essential skills
Of course, the devil is in the details. For example, while you may apply at a port of entry, it is in your best interest to apply to a visa office.

Working as an American investor in Canada
If you are a US citizen, you may work as an investor in Canada under the following conditions:

You work for an American enterprise
The enterprise has made or is making a substantial investment in Canada
Your role is solely to direct and develop the enterprise in Canada
The position is executive, supervisory or needs essential skills
Of course, this is a simplified list. For example, you need to know what is a substantial investment or an essential-skills role.

Working as a professional American
If you are a US citizen, you may work as a professional in Canada under the following CUSMA criteria:

Your job falls under one of the 63 CUSMA occupations
You meet the educational credentials for the job
A Canadian employer has offered you a valid job offer
Of course, just like the other CUSMA options, you need to meet the nitty-gritty of this work permit option.

quote.msg: 咁你點解又熟加拿大啲野？你以前住過？美國人易啲去加拿大打工？
I don't think so

https://www.settler.ca/english/can-us-citizens-work-in-canada/
A work permit is a must for US workers in Canada.
Unless your job is exempt from a work permit, you must receive a permit to work in Canada. Unfortunately, this rule applies to US citizens just like other applicants. However, you may apply for a work permit at a port of entry. There are some exceptional cases that you are better off if you apply before entering Canada. Consequently, consult with a professional before travelling to Canada.

CUSMA an opportunity for US citizens to work in Canada
CUSMA, aka USMCA or NAFTA 2.0, is an economic treaty between Canada, the United States and Mexico. The main focus of CUSMA is the trade of goods and services between these countries. However, it also considers labour movements. As a result, you may work as a US citizen in Canada if one of the following CUSMA provisions apply to you.

Traders
Investors
Professionals
Intra-company transferees
Of course, the main benefit of CUSMA work permits is LMIA exemption.

Working as an American trader in Canada
CUSMA defines an American Trader as a US citizen who intends to get a work permit under the following circumstances:

They work for an American enterprise
Trade is mainly between the US, Canada and Mexico
Their activities focus on trade in services or goods
The position is executive, supervisory or needs essential skills
Of course, the devil is in the details. For example, while you may apply at a port of entry, it is in your best interest to apply to a visa office.

Working as an American investor in Canada
If you are a US citizen, you may work as an investor in Canada under the following conditions:

You work for an American enterprise
The enterprise has made or is making a substantial investment in Canada
Your role is solely to direct and develop the enterprise in Canada
The position is executive, supervisory or needs essential skills
Of course, this is a simplified list. For example, you need to know what is a substantial investment or an essential-skills role.

Working as a professional American
If you are a US citizen, you may work as a professional in Canada under the following CUSMA criteria:

Your job falls under one of the 63 CUSMA occupations
You meet the educational credentials for the job
A Canadian employer has offered you a valid job offer
Of course, just like the other CUSMA options, you need to meet the nitty-gritty of this work permit option.

replies.msg:
Working as an American intra-company transferee
If you are a US citizen, you may work in Canada if your company decides to transfer you to their Canadian branch or subsidiary. However, you need to meet specific criteria. For example, your role must be an executive, senior managerial or specialized knowledge position. Of course, you may read the following article for more information:

Intra-company Transferee Work Permit – ICT Canada
Can a US citizen work in Canada as a business visitor?
Business visitors have the privilege of working in Canada under subsection 186(a) of the Immigration Regulations. Since this privilege covers all nationalities, the US citizens are no exception. Nonetheless, if you need more information, read the following articles:

Business Visitors to Canada
Invitation Letter for Business Visitors to Canada
The International Mobility Program and US citizens
The International Mobility Program (IMP) paves the way to work in Canada without an LMIA. Of course, CUSMA falls under IMP. However, there are many other great options under the IMP that US citizens can enjoy. Here are some examples:

TV and film production
Significant contributions to Canada
Reciprocity (for artists only)
Francophone mobility
Self-employed people or entrepreneurs
This list is not comprehensive. Therefore, consult with a professional to explore your options.

Canadian open work permits for US citizens
Some US citizens could qualify for an open work permit in Canada. An open work permit allows you to work for any employer in Canada. However, don’t get too excited. Unfortunately, the criteria for an open work permit is exceptionally tight. Consider reading the following article for more information.

Open Work Permit Canada
Working in Canada without a work permit
As an American citizen, sometimes you qualify to work in Canada without a permit. For example, professional speakers may deliver speeches in Canada. However, the events they attend must be less than five days. Click here to see a list of work options in Canada without a permit.

Can I still work in Canada if I do not fall under any of the previous options?
If you do not meet the requirements of any of the previous options, you could still work in Canada. However,

you need to receive a job offer from a Canadian employer, and
Service Canada must issue a positive LMIA letter for the job.
What if I do not have a job offer?
If you are a US citizen who wants to work in Canada, but you do not have a job offer, then visit the following pages:

Job Search Websites – Canada Work Permit and Immigration
Cold Calling for Job Search – A Canada Visa and Work Permit Perspective
If you wish to visit or move to Canada, please fill out our free assessment form. We will review it for free, but we will contact you only if we find an opportunity for you. Alternatively, you may book a consultation session. Consultation sessions are not free, but you will receive formal advice from a licenced practitioner.
